sentences.en: A deal between the pair would perhaps be more of a dalliance, conditional and undeclared.
sentences.cn: 在一次浪漫邂逅的表面下,双方可能还达成了条件更多且未公开的交易.

sentences.en: In February 1967, she began a dalliance with Robin Douglas - Home, 35, a talented and troubled pianist and the nephew of a former prime minister.
sentences.cn: 1967年2月, 玛格丽特与一位前首相的侄子、才华横溢但天性伤感的钢琴家35岁的罗宾·道格拉斯-霍姆开始了一段情缘.

sentences.en: In Jordan, this is a shortcut to signal interest in a dalliance.
sentences.cn: 在约旦，这个是一个调情的手势。

sentences.en: It turned out to be his last dalliance with the education system.
sentences.cn: 这一次竟成了他对教育体制最后的嘲弄。

sentences.en: Slight dalliance with her makes the very diminutive seem as big as life.
sentences.cn: 与她稍作嬉戏就会使无足轻重的小事变得性命攸关.

trans.tran_en: If two people have a brief romantic relationship, you can say that they have a dalliance with each other, especially if they do not take it seriously
